definitions.text: a precipitated solid substance in suspension or after settling or filtering

examples: The crisis precipitated by Russia's revolution

definitions.text: separate as a fine suspension of solid particles

examples: rain, snow and sleet were falling
Vesuvius precipitated its fiery, destructive rage on Herculaneum
Our economy precipitated into complete ruin
The bridge broke and precipitated the train into the river below

definitions.text: done with very great haste and without due deliberation; - Shakespeare; - Arthur Geddes
examples: hasty makeshifts take the place of planning
rejected what was regarded as an overhasty plan for reconversion
wondered whether they had been rather precipitate in deposing the king
